Cons. Rd. Light Dist.No.1 -- 7.0 Mills - Metro Council - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Consolidated Road Lighting District No. 1 Proposition

Summary:  Continuation of 7.0 mills property tax for a period of ten (10) years to provide funds for purposes of providing, maintaining and operating street lights of Consolidated Road Lighting District No. 1.
Race.FullText: Shall Consolidated Road Lighting District No. 1 of the Parish of East Baton Rouge, State of Louisiana, under the provisions of Article VI, Section 32 of the 1974 Louisiana Constitution, and other constitutional and statutory authority supplemental thereto, be authorized to continue to levy and collect, and adopt an ordinance providing for such levy and collection, of an ad valorem tax of seven (7.00) mills (the "Tax") (an estimated $810,000 is reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the Tax for an entire year), in each calendar year on all property subject to taxation in Consolidated Road Lighting District No. 1 of the Parish of East Baton Rouge, for a period of ten (10) years, commencing in the year 2009 to and including the year 2018, and shall the avails or proceeds of said Tax (after paying the reasonable and necessary expenses of collecting and administering the Tax, if any) be used entirely and exclusively for the purpose of providing, maintaining and operating electric lights on the streets, roads, highways, alleys, and public places of the Consolidated Road Lighting District No. 1 of the Parish of East Baton Rouge, being works of public improvements?

Race.SpecificTitle: Chaneyville FPD No. 7 -- 10 Mill - Metro Council - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Chaneyville Fire Protection District No. 7 Proposition

Summary:  Levy and collection of a ten (10) mill property tax for a period of ten (10) years to provide funds for developing, maintaining and operating the fire protection facilities of the Chaneyville Fire Protection District No. 7 within the Parish of East Baton Rouge, Louisiana.
Race.FullText: Shall the Chaneyville Fire Protection District No. 7 of the Parish of East Baton Rouge, State of Louisiana, under the provisions of Article VI, Section 19 of the 1974 Louisiana Constitution, Section 1501 of Title 40 of the Louisiana Revised Statutes of 1950, as amended, and other constitutional and statutory authority supplemental thereto, be authorized to levy and collection, and adopt an ordinance providing for such levy and collection, of an ad valorem tax of ten (10) mills (the "Tax") (an estimated $125,000 is reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the Tax for an entire year), in each calendar year on all property subject to taxation in the Chaneyville Fire Protection District No. 7 of the Parish of East Baton Rouge, for a period of ten (10) years, commencing in the year 2009 to and including the year 2018, and shall the avails or proceeds of said Tax (after paying the reasonable and necessary expenses of collection and administering the Tax, if any) be used entirely and exclusively for the development, operation and maintenance of the fire protection facilities of the Chaneyville Fire Protection District No. 7 and paying the costs of obtaining water for fire protection purposes, including charges for fire hydrant rentals and service, within the Chaneyville Fire Protection District No. 7 of the Parish of East Baton Rouge?

Race.SpecificTitle: Alsen FPD No. 9 -- 5 Mill - Metro Council - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Alsen Fire Protection District No. 9 Proposition

Summary:  Continuation of the existing five (5) mill property tax for a period of ten (10) years to provide funds for development, operation and maintenance purposes of the Alsen Fire Protection District.
Race.FullText: Shall the Alsen Fire Protection District No. 9 of the Parish of East Baton Rouge, State of Louisiana, under the provisions of Article VI, Section 19 of the 1974 Louisiana Constitution, Part I of Chapter 7 of the Louisiana Revised Statutes of 1950, as amended (La. R.S. 40:1501), and other constitutional and statutory authority supplemental thereto, be authorized to continue to levy and collect, and adopt an ordinance providing for such levy and collection, of an ad valorem tax of five (5) mills (the "Tax") (an estimated $74,000 is reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the Tax for an entire year), in each calendar year on all property subject to taxation in the Alsen Fire Protection District No. 9 of the Parish of East Baton Rouge, for a period of ten (10) years, commencing in the year 2009 to and including the year 2018, and shall the avails or proceeds of said Tax be used entirely and exclusively for the development, operation and maintenance of the fire protection facilities of the Alsen Fire Protection District No. 9 and paying the costs of obtaining water for fire protection purposes, including charges for fire hydrant rentals and service, within the Alsen Fire Protection District No. 9 of the Parish of East Baton Rouge?
